title: Does anyone use Google or any other search engine anymore? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well most of the websites I utilize on a daily basis are already bookmarked, but yes I still use Google constantly when researching a topic. According to Net Market Share (as of April 2017) the global marketing share percentage, in terms of the use of Search Engines heavily favours Google, with over 77%. This again reinforces that fact that Google are the market leaders, however it also highlights that the "Others" such as Yahoo, Bing and Baidu etc still hold a large audience and it would be silly to simply ignore them. It's interesting to note that Google's large market share is still on the increase. Last year we saw a 67% market share for Google, so Google has taken another 10% of the market from its rivals in just the past 12 months. You can read the rest of the article here: Search Engine Statistics 2017 - Smart Insights Digital Marketing Advice

I use qwant, and swisscows on my laptop, bing and qwant on my flip phone. I only use Google on my Nintendo DSI because that is one of the only search engines that actually works on there. I use swisscows the most though. If you want more privacy, I would recommend Swisscows die alternative, datensichere Suchmaschine. and Qwant - The search engine that respects your privacy . Swisscows blocks violent and adult content, because their focus is not only privacy, but also family friendly content. The only thing about qwant is that they have a “bot checker” when you search a lot of things at once; it is harder to click on the circles or squares on my flip phone.
